dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on January 25, 2022
titles: not reliable for local businesses search
reviews: \nNot reliable for local businesses searches.  there's no easy way to get your business register on Amazon Alexa. it is free and easy for Google, Bing, and Apple.  but you have to pay in order to get your business listed on Alexa.I want a voice search that is accurate and give me all the listings for business like google home does.because it is not easy I get scammers calling me all the time wanting to put my business on Amazon Alexa and they use Amazon Alexa to scam people in to paying them for those listings..\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on June 30, 2021
reviews: \nReturned because I cannot use all my Phillips Hue bulbs with this hub AND the Phillips wireless dimmers I have at the same time.  It was either one or the other.  The range was not very good anyway, I could not use my bulbs that were a few rooms away from hub.  My other dislikes which are subjective is I really dislike the spherical shape and a white power cord with the black echo doesn't make sense.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on April 20, 2022
reviews: \nA new "feature" of Echo is that it suggests that you buy things. If it keeps doing it, I will throw it in the damn trash. I bought it to perform tasks, not suggest purchases.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on November 26, 2021
reviews: \nI have  a large number of in wall smart switches that use zwave.  This device will not support them.  I'm not spending several hundred dollars plus time and effort to replace those devices.  It would have been nice to ditch Smartthings in favor of an Alexa based hub.  But I need zwave to do it.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 21, 2021
titles: Constant "Advertisements" with no option to opt out.
reviews: \nI've used echo devices since the beta of the first generation, but the constant recommendations which are just advertisements, have made the devices a major annoyance to use rather then a helpful tool. The "by the way" only started to get bad the last year or so, but now I hear that phrase at least twice a day and there is NO way to shut it off! There are a few tricks to lower the number of times Alexia does this, but that seems to only lower it from every other time I use the echo to every 4th time. We paid for these devices at full price, give us the option to opt out!\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 24, 2020
titles: Great looking and functional. Bad sound quality for price
reviews: \nI currently have 6 alexa speakers and countless other Amazon smart plugs and lights and fire sticks and the ring camera and whatever else I have. I love Amazon products. They can\u2019t be beat. However, I purchased this new speaker. It looks very unique compared to the other speakers and the lights on the bottom add a nice touch. The sound quality however is almost no different from the original echo dot. I have owned and built a lot of stereo systems in home and car so I know a decent amount about sound quality. The gen 3 in my opinion has way better sound quality and bass. I don\u2019t know if I got a bad speaker or if Amazon is trying to pull a fast one for the holiday season and mass producing cheap products to sell at an outrageous price. Like I said, I love Amazon products. Haven\u2019t had one issue that hasn\u2019t been easily solved until now. Very dissatisfied\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 5, 2021
titles: Wish I could give it a lower rating it really doesn\u2019t deserve 1 star
reviews: \nIt\u2019s always a mystery with Amazon echoe . Today your fire stick works but only with fire stick remote.next week only the Samsung remote works and the fire stick remote won\u2019t. Next week the Kasa light switches stop working but the Phillips hue bridge finally starts working after a month down. Next week the fan light switch stops working because smartthings app quit on you. But maybe by now they fixed the Kasa light switches. Next week the volume on your Samsung tv quits working and they tell you it\u2019s not supposed to but tit worked the weeks before. Next week it\u2019s locks or your garage door openers turn to not work. The point is they are horrible at making updates and you\u2019ll rarely if ever have a time when everything works. Oh yea don\u2019t forget about the voice recognition hat constantly goes out or the blue rings that just sit spin blue for hours on end. Amazon developers are not very good at what they do and you will be frustrated more than the enjoyment you\u2019ll get from any of their devices. Save yourself a headache and by google home.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on February 4, 2021
titles: Not the best version to buy if you have a Labrador Retriever or other ball-loving dog...
reviews: \nOkay, to be fair, this device works well, but I rated it one star for a very important "buyer beware" reason:  It's shaped like a ball.  A slightly larger-than-tennis-ball size ball.  The good news:  My Labrador Retriever did not eat it or chew it.  But...he does get on the bed and he did see it on my night stand....and he thought I had gotten him a new toy but was not giving it to him.  He pouted.  He crawled up to me, kept looking back and forth at me  and then the "ball".  And whined.  Whined and cried incessantly.  Got in my face and kissed me. I even let him sniff it and had it play music and an announcement.  It did not matter.  He thought it was a ball.  HIS ball.  His new ball.  And I was withholding it from him.  We literally had to move it when he was not looking and swap it with the "hockey puck" version from another room.  If you have a ball-obsessed dog (aka retriever), do NOT BUY THIS MODEL!  You're welcome.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 11, 2021
titles: Alexa refuses to respond, yelling does not help either, buy if you like the aggravation
reviews: \nI have many Amazon smart plugs, and turning them on and off using Alexa is a nightmare. She wakes up whenever she wants, and most of the time she does not cooperate. I set and reset settings to no avail.Mis\xe9rable piece of hardware, Siri is much better, it never failed to reply to your command.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 7, 2020
titles: Either Alexa is too loud \u2014 everything else is quiet or Alexa is quiet and the rest is loud.
reviews: \nIt doesn\u2019t work as well as the third gen. does. The sound, the voice recognition, balance of the volume \u2014 it\u2019s very very off.The most irritating part is the balance between the Alexa voice and the music/whatever I need it to play. I try to add volume, because it\u2019s quite and hard to hear \u2014 then I ask Alex to set up a timer and it feels like it screams. I turn the volume down, then I don\u2019t hear the timer. Brilliant.Sleeping sounds is also my favorite feature, on the 3rd gen it would work perfectly. Here it\u2019s a pain. White noise on level 3 \u2014 won\u2019t hear the alarm in the morning because it\u2019s too quiet.I just cannot seem to figure it out.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on November 19, 2021
titles: Great for a day, in the drawer now
reviews: \nWe have several of the echo 3rd gens and I wish we hadn't even tried this one. I'm replacing it with a Gen 3. I finally unplugged this one and put it away cause it was as useless as a paperweight in a digital office. Customer service said it wasn't able to be returned. It would randomly disconnect from the wifi. Nothing helped. You could reconnect it and an hour later it would disconnect again. Horrible response times. And honestly the sound quality was better on the 3rd Gen. This one was a major disappointment. I definitely don't recommend this one.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on June 6, 2021
titles: Do you like to be constantly harassed for an upgrade to Amazon music?
reviews: \nI love smart house goods... In theory.However, do you want to be harassed constantly to upgrade your Amazon music service? By constantly I literally mean dozens of times a day and almost every other time you ask for a song? It is extremely frustrating especially since I am already a prime member. There are no options to turn this off either.I often find myself using my phone to listen to YouTube because it is easier.This thing is just a mobile ad house to make Bezos richer.  Do yourself a favor and get a year membership to a streaming service instead of this thing.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on June 28, 2021
reviews: \nWhat happened? i thought i was upgrading from a 1st generation to 4th generation, boy oh boy, what a letdown, Alexa is now officially deaf. I can be as close as a couple of feet to it and it MIGHT respond, just MIGHT.  Funny thing is, i have an echo show in a different room  and it responds even though it, behind an adjacent wall. So therefor the Brand spanking new Echo is being returned.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on June 8, 2021
titles: if you but it get a tutorial on youtube the manual does not help you
reviews: \nI liked it but after a few days it would not let me play music and it wont let me put anything on the shopping list\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 23, 2020
titles: Can\u2019t take or manage calls unless you use the Alexa app!
reviews: \nGot this as a gift and returned it the same day. This was a Christmas gift. I use web-ex, MS teams and my phone all day at work for calls, from my home office. Well my fianc\xe9 thought this would be a great addition to my home office. Nope! This device doesn\u2019t allow you to do any calls other than through the Alexa app. Means you can\u2019t Accept an in coming call or route calls to the speaker, or use it as just a Bluetooth device. All audio has to be routed through the Alexa app. We spent more time researching how to use it then actually using it. Oh and I should mention my fianc\xe9 literally does tier 3 engineering support for Mac and PC for his job, he\u2019s pretty technical. Once we found out it didn\u2019t do what we wanted, we packaged it up and requested a refund right away. Very disappointed with this product. Ruined my Christmas!\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 5, 2021
reviews: \nOther non-Apple devices are compatible with AirPlay, why not Echo?  I will have to purchase a different device. Boooo!\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on November 20, 2021
reviews: \nI now strongly discourage purchasing an alexa device. After asking simple questions like "what is the weather" you now consistently get a "by the way...would you like to browse an audiobook selection". I've researched ways for stopping this, but you can't. I've had to turn my devices into "kid" mode to stop the constant sales pitch. It's awful and I know dread using it. Check out the google home.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on November 23, 2020
titles: No improvement in Alexa's voice.  Still muddy as ever
reviews: \nI have 1st and 2nd generation echo devices (3 echos and 3 dots).  Biggest complaint is Alexa's voice always sounding muddy.  You ask a question and often can't understand what she's saying.  I was hoping this new generation would be better, it is not.  While music sounds better, the voice is still bad as ever.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 20, 2020
reviews: \nI got so excited when I saw the 4th gen devices. I ordered one of each, Echo and Echo Dot. I wanted to add these two devices to the three Echo Dot 3rd gen I already have. That is where the nightmare began.  I would give a command, the blue lights would swirl around for 10 to 15 seconds and I would finally get a response. My 3rd gen devices had an amazing response time. There is a compatibility issue that tech support wasn't aware of and was unable to correct. After spending hours and hours trying to get them to work together (3rd and 4th gen) I gave up and returned both Echo 4th gen and Echo Dot 4th gen. I may order later, after the kinks have been worked out.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 7, 2021
titles: Not a good and reliable product.
reviews: \nHello everyone, Amazon products are generally good but this one disappointed me very much. I bought this device because of the better speaker but was very disappointed that the speaker performance is worst that the EchoDot Gen-1.over the last 9 months I had to reset this device almost 7 time.and now the device is stuck in the endless software update mode and not functional at all.Amazon was very clever to hide the limited warranty for only 3 months in the fine print (Just this device).Very disappointed Amazon....\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on February 18, 2021
reviews: \nThis unit is very difficult to set up with out the use of a "smart" phone.  Had to have my son with a "smart" phone come over and completely reconfigure my Amazon account to recognize his phone.  I would imagine that there is anapp somewhere that will help with this problem but be advised that although the sound is great setting it up can be a real pain.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on November 19, 2021
reviews: \nI REFUSE to use any alexa products until they add a switch to TURN OFF recommendations and DID YOU KNOW?  ..  Answer my question or do as I ask and THAT IS ALL.  Amazon is aware of the feedback on this and refuses to turn it off.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 26, 2020
reviews: \nDo not buy. I got this as a gift for a friend.  After much time trying to setup we decided to just return it. The Alexis app is glitchy at best. We had to setup on phone which we did not want to do,but it was a big hassle on chromebook. The app would not play spotify which was one of the main reasons we bought it... After much frustration and ultimately failing to finish setup we gave up. This was the first and lastime I will ever purchase any Amazon device.....let's be real here...Amazon can't even keep their shopping app working correctly. I feel bad about giving this as a gift to my friend. Totally ruined the joy of gift giving.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 19, 2020
reviews: \nIt\u2019s nice to look at , the sound is good. But like I\u2019ve heard others say , it doesn\u2019t seem to hear my voice when I speak to it. I wish I hadn\u2019t spent the money on this and bought a 3rd generation instead.I\u2019ve had every Version of the echo and this is really disappointing. Sorry Amazon\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 29, 2020
titles: Terrible sound quality and ugly cord
reviews: \nThis is way a step backward for the dot. I have every generation of it. This one is crap. First, it\u2019s charcoal but the cord and plu are white? Ok...And the sound is garbage. The OG one sounds better. I\u2019m really disappointed. If I hadn\u2019t paid next to nothing for it on a lightening deal, I\u2019d send it back. It\u2019s not worth full price. The 3rd generation is way better.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on March 13, 2021
titles: Definitely a step back for Echo Dots
reviews: \nSo it's all of what you expect.  But ... sound quality is less than the Echo Dot 3 and something else bothers me about it... seeing it light up when it's actually listening to me.  I have to go out of my way to see it.  Perhaps that's at least in part due to having it on dark furniture, but ... yah, it's a problem.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 5, 2021
reviews: \nIt\u2019s simple. I already know Amazon is tracking much about me and what I do. I have agreed to that as a part of the convenience of Alexa. But the recent \u201cby the way\u201d sales pitches after everything I do, even as simple as setting a time are just too invasive. I\u2019m done with using Alexa.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on October 23, 2020
reviews: \nNot impressed with the sound. I bought this to replace my jbl charge 3 that broke down, and this comes nowhere near the same rich sound as the charge 3. Not being wireless like every other speaker is ridiculous in 2020, get with it amazon. Alexa smart app not worth the crappy "premium" sound. Returning this in the morning.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on April 6, 2021
titles: Not for people outside of North America
reviews: \nI purchased an "eco 8" without looking at the small print. I can't play my Apple music or Zoom on it as it's only for the people in North America. Amazon; the world is bigger than that. The sound and display quality is very good. Usability in my part of the world is dismal.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on January 9, 2022
reviews: \nRing products will disconnect after a day or so. Ring support says not to use this device as a bridge since is doesn\u2019t not work well.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 12, 2021
titles: Works 1/4 of the time if you\u2019re lucky.
reviews: \nGarbage. These Echoes are suppose to make things more convenient. Well, that couldn\u2019t be farther from the truth. Half the skills I\u2019ve enabled work 1/4 of the time if I\u2019m lucky. Music just stops playing all the time and the list goes on. Beyond frustrating. Almost ready to take my Echo devices to e-waste and call it a loss. The only recommendation I\u2019d give is to avoid them.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 8, 2021
reviews: \nAfter purchasing this product, I have been subjected to listen to "Connected to... [insert device here]" everyday at random times, even when my device is not making any noise. It is because of this announcement alone that I have switched to Google's Nest line which has never given me an annoyance like this.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on November 20, 2020
reviews: \nGoing Green and making electronics with recycled materials? Since when did leftover dinner made from 4 nights prior ever make for a fantastically delicious entre for dinner on the 5th night of the week? In theory, good idea... but green electronics make not for a very good product. Just like recycled batteries, ammunition, and most other "green" recycled crap out there, it's pure junk! Oh! Except for recycled plastic trash/ grocery bags but unfortunately those are illegal to now use in Oregon. I betcha this crappy dot made from recycled goods last longer in the dirt than a trash bag! Which kind will be going straight to the tomatoe garden, in the dirt, for a 3rd and final "recycle" happy to do my part. Thanks mean green's!\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on May 12, 2021
reviews: \nTerrible voice recognition. I have to repeat commands multiples  times. Sound quality is also a step backwards.  Front facing speakers seem like a good idea,  but this is not an audiophile system. The 360 sound is more  practical. Amazon you messed up.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 6, 2020
titles: Echo isi going downhill - time to switch?
reviews: \nI am a long time echo user.  I have multiple unites throughout the house and they control climate and lights. However, Echo and specifically ALEXA are becoming increasingly intrusive. I do not want Alexa to remind me to reorder product from Amazon, I do not want Echo to ask me any followup questions. Even if the question is to a free vs a paid Alexa ad on it is still annoying. Indeed, there is a process with several steps to configure Alexa to not ask further questions.  BUT, somehow Amazon repeatedly resets that configuration and defaults back to selling us or trying to get us to improve engagement. My dating with Alexa is almost at an end.  I hope someone at Amazon reads this as I know others who have the same problem.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on January 16, 2021
titles: Worse device ever, DO NOT PURCHASE.
reviews: \nMy daughter sent me this for Christmas, very thoughtful of her and love her for it. However it is now January 15 have been trying to get it set up and working. Not happening, I am now the proud owner of a service that you have to sign up for to the tune of $19.99 for a lifetime use. I have tried so many times to get this working it has added a bunch more gray hairs on my head. Whomever created this they owe me a box of Revlon hair dye. Truly a horrible device. Don't waste your money, it doesn't deserve any stars. But couldn't post this review without putting a a star on it.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on September 7, 2021
reviews: \nPlease allow Alexa to connect to a hidden network.  Perhaps having your wifi network names broadcast around the neighborhood was fine in the past,  these days it is not recommended.  I go to my router settings and uncheck the \u201chide network\u201d button and connect Alexa no problem, but when I go back to the router and hide the network Alexa disconnects.  Please update the software to allow hidden networks.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on May 19, 2021
reviews: \nTotal crap. I have 10 echos and even install this product in customer homes.  After some update, Alexa doesn't listen when trying to use a routine or tell it to stop reminding.  I even checked the history and she did understand what I am saying.  This is happening on multiple customer accounts. When I try to contact support, all they do is waste my time trying to get me to perform the same troubleshooting steps that didn't work the first time.I am going to Google home\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on March 11, 2021
reviews: \nThis was wonderful for 2 months. Now it has a terrible static that is so loud it's awful. I can't return it because it's been 4 months and I would not have spent $100 for something to last only a few months. Terrible!!!!\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 5, 2020
reviews: \nI expected a lot more from this and expected this to be louder than our previous echo but I was wrong. The sound quality is not that great it sounds very muffled and not as clear not as much base and not as loud as our later motto echo! It worked for a little bit and then suddenly it stops playing music all together, we have tried everything we have the deregistered, restarted, the darn thing And it constantly says try again later! So frustrating! We have not called Amazon or try to troubleshoot yet Because honestly who wants to be on the phone forever. We actually received this as a wedding present from our Amazon registry\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 7, 2021
reviews: \nDecember 7th, 2021, Alexa stopped operating all Philips products. Philips' proprietary app still functions GREAT, but Amazon's Alexa stopped interfacing with the lights. Many people on the forum are saying GOOGLE is a better product for controlling smart home devices, and after this most recent failure(has failed several times before and had to be reinstalled), I'm beginners by to see that if you want a foolproof streamlined interface, DON'T get Alexa with it!\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on January 4, 2021
reviews: \nI bought this primarily for music. The sound quality and volume are pretty good, but it doesn\u2019t connect as it should to Pandora. From the reviews I see, this is an ongoing issue and one I find to be unacceptable and frustrating.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on May 8, 2021
reviews: \nHave to subscribe to get certain songs. Trading it back in! Not really all that load. I don\u2019t hear a huge difference between this one and the Dot!\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 9, 2020
titles: Doesn't respond to voice well. downgrade
reviews: \nIf you turn up the volume to 1/2 the max you literally have to yell ALEXA!!! if volume was put all the way up on the device you would literally have to scream at it from 2 feet away for her to respond. Downgrade\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on May 25, 2021
reviews: \nBy the way, if you want a voice ad after almost every response, alexa devices are a fantastic choice! Did you know that you can get free advertisements just by asking alexa for the weather. I think you might like all of the ads that alexa tells you about when you turn off the lights to go to bed.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on July 11, 2021
reviews: \nI gave the product 2 rating because it would not stay connected to wi-fi. After resetting the Echo for four days with no success, I decided to return it for a refund. The sound quality was great, but the resets were bothersome.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on November 24, 2020
reviews: \nMy wife bought one of these thinking the sound would be really good for listening to music.  Not so.  I walked in the door from work and heard music playing that was muffled and muddy sounding.  Wife called support who walked her through several processes but made no difference.  The unit also took about 10 seconds to respond to anything said to Alexa.  Wife sent it back and bought another dot gen. 3 instead.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on January 8, 2021
reviews: \nI purchased 3 of the 4th gen echo's for my home. Right away I noticed that Alexa does not respond to with the closest device. For example, when asking Alexa to set a timer in my kitchen, the device in my kitchen didn't respond but the one in my son's room (across the house) did. Another frustrating feature is when I ask Alexa to play radio stations, the response is currently unavailable. I have reset the device many times, reset my router, and disconnected/reconnected the internet to the device. For the price point and quality, I was very disappointed.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on January 18, 2021
reviews: \nTired of yelling at this echo to get it to pick up my voice. Going back to my 3rd gen. Sound sensitivity settings via the app would be a much welcome feature in the future.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on July 27, 2021
reviews: \nDoes not hear me, is not responsive. About 6 to 8 times a day I have to reset it because it only hears me after immediately being reset. I even had them send me a replacement Kaylayn wasn\u2019t working it is very frustrating and is a huge piece of crap\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on February 27, 2021
reviews: \nNow with Alexa, your evenings can be like:"Now connected to [device name]""Now connected to [device name]""Now connected to [device name]""Now connected to [device name]""Now connected to [device name]""Now connected to [device name]""Now connected to [device name]""Now connected to [device name]""Now connected to [device name]""Now connected to [device name]""Now connected to [device name]""Now connected to [device name]""Now connected to [device name]""Now connected to [device name]""Now connected to [device name]""Now connected to [device name]"\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on November 9, 2020
reviews: \nWhere to start? Sound quality is OK, muddled, not well balanced with a subwoofer, much happier with my 2nd/3rd generation Echo Dots. The white cord is too short and too white. Connectivity was intermitted "I'm having trouble, please try again later," so much so that Amazon wanted me to return both units. In fairness, the sound brightened up after a couple hours of use but no where near the point of feeling good about paying $200/pair. I'm sure Amazon will eventually get these right as it would be great to have a fully integrated and high fidelity sound system.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on November 8, 2020
reviews: \nI have owned the Alexa for years and it works fine IF Frontier is giving me enough band width on the internet. That is about 60% of the time. It is infuriating when you ask Alexa for something or to do something and you get, "I'm sorry I can not understand, the internet is down. This when my WiFi system is humming at full power but no connection to the outside world. These products all stink when they are not programmed to work without internet!\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on February 7, 2021
reviews: \nI regret investing the money to buy this device. More than one year into ownership, there's a malfunction so it will randomly play music that we did not select at 3 a.m. It's the weirdest glitch. Being woke up to bad techno music in the middle of the night. It's almost like a joke. Except it's not funny. Amazon said our warranty expired so there's nothing we can do. I don't know how common this problem is. But believe me, I wish we hadn't bought this.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on November 20, 2020
titles: Alexa does not know when to shut up...
reviews: \nI used to enjoy using Alexa, but over time she's gotten a lot more annoying and makes a lot of unnecessary suggestions. I don't use it nearly as much as I used to because instead of being convenient, it's more of a chore to use the voice assistant than it is to use my phone. If you're just getting into assistants, I'd skip the Echo and go with a Google Assistant. My friend's Assistant gets straight to the point and isn't nearly as annoying, and I wish that was the ecosystem I'd gone with.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 13, 2020
reviews: \nVoice is loud on the speaker but the rest of the sound like music is quiet. It's really bad hearing you. I like the gen3 much more.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on March 6, 2021
reviews: \nSorry, the internet isn't available right now, please check your settings in the Alexa app. Well, I hate you Alexa. Are you sure the internet isn't available? Is this messing coming through? 100 million apps. Never a single day without screwing up and having to restart one of these devises. A lot of times when you really rely on it and need something done immediately.  When it works it is great, if only it worked consistently. Thanks for making hands free applications so useless.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on February 22, 2021
reviews: \nBeware stick with the echo dot third-generation this fourth generation has problems and is annoying very unhappy with the one I have!!\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on February 17, 2021
titles: Buy 3rd gen Echo Plus, not this!
reviews: \nAbsolutely horrible!!! My 3rd Gen Echo Plus outperforms this in every way possible. I don\u2019t know how this made it passed QC. Received this as a gift and I still returned it. Only thing that\u2019s good is the looks. It is very attractive, but sound quality is weak, voice recognition is cumbersome, and struggles to connect to WiFi (in a 2 bedroom condo) when my other 3 (3rd Gen) Echo Pluses never have/nor had an issue. Disappointing.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on October 21, 2021
titles: Does not respond 50% of the time!
reviews: \nThis is a piece of crap for $99.00.... Does not respond 50% or more of the time.  Most of the timea device from another room will answer.  wth?  I had an Amazon First Edition Alexa and turned it in for this "upgrade" (???)  I sure wish I had it backSave your money and get one or two Echo Dots for $25.00\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 30, 2020
reviews: \nEcho dot 3 gen sounded way better and responded faster. This one sounds terrible when you play music.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on January 9, 2021
reviews: \nMy 3rd gen had much better sound. This has no bass. Severely disappointed.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 8, 2020
titles: Asks more annoying questions than your deranged cousins toddler
reviews: \nIt started out fun but has become obnoxious. Every time I ask it to do something, it turns into a game of twenty question. Earlier I set a two minute timer and it asked \u201cwould you like me to remind you when to eat lunch?\u201d Followed by \u201cwould you like to purchase this book again?\u201d Then \u201clook at the Alexa App for new skills.\u201dI just want a two minute timer. It\u2019s obnoxious.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on May 1, 2021
reviews: \nI bought mine four months ago, and just a few days past their "warrantee", it broke.  After dealing with technical services, factory resetting, changing cords and following all instructions, my answer from Amazon was, basically, 'sucks to be you'.  Technology like this should have a longer lifespan, and should ABSOLUTELY have a better warrantee than it does.  So until it does, I'd highly suggest NOT wasting your money on this.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on February 9, 2021
titles: Can't stop it from announcing what source it's playing.
reviews: \nIt's very annoying that everytime it starts playing audio it announces what the source is. Who wants to know this? Why can't it be turned off? This ruins my experience using this Echo. dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 18, 2020
reviews: \nReceived it as a gift and it never paired with my iPhone XR or any devices in the house. I dropped it off at Goodwill. I have Amazon account and Amazon music. Alexa is worthless. dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on June 29, 2021
reviews: \nI have owned almost all the versions of Alexa at one time or another. The primary reason I use them is for music and to remotely control the lights in my home.The room that I put this device (Echo Ball) in is replacing a 3rd generation Echo Dot so that is what I am comparing it to.The ball is bigger and takes up more table space than the dot.The ball has better sound quality than the dot.The ball appears to be directional meaning there is a definite front and back to it.  As a result you will want to point the front towards your audience to get the best sound possible. The dot can be pointed in any direction and the sound quality appears to the the same.The biggest negative is that the ball frequently doesn't hear me when I speak to it.  For whatever reason the dot is much better at picking up voices.Currently the ball is being sold for $99 but I purchased mine during Prime Day so I only paid $59.Bottom line, I don't think it's worth $99 but $59 was a reasonable price.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on January 1, 2022
reviews: \nVery disappointed with the installation process of this echo.  First off, the user manual is useless if you have any issues.  It should come with a much larger manual that details issue resolution.  Plus, much more details on connecting other devices.  Getting the device connected to the network was a nightmare.  Took at least a dozen tries to get that done and I still have no idea why it finally worked.  Amazon really needs to work on making the install piece as easy as connecting a phone to a hotspot.  Don't recommend it for people who aren't tech savvy.\n

Those work perfectly and are uses everyday.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on July 12, 2022
titles: Absolute horrible customer service and devices not working.
reviews: \nBecause I have many Zigbee devices that require a hub or Alexa with a built-in hub like my 3rd generation Echo Plus. I wanted to replace it with three new Gen4 devices around the house. I specifically asked tech support if pre-configuring would eliminate the need to re-register ALL my devices and they said YES.  What a crock of BS. Not one of the three Echo 4gen came with any pre-configuration at all. The Echo dots I ordered did but they don't control Zigbee devices. Amazon tech support doesn't know their ass from a hole in the ground. "Oh call us"..why would I call people that lied to me in the first place? Why would I call people I can't understand because of their thick accent? Why would I call someone in India to solve a problem here? That is asking for more frustration. The fact that they sent the wrong colored power adapters with them is proof of the poor quality control Amazon uses with their devices. Black device/white power brick. Zigbee does not work and WiFi signal is poor. Latests excuse was that my distributed switched network with 4 high speed acess points doesn't have the bandwidth to  handle 10 Alexa devices. I have the bandwidth for hundreds of devices. They hire off the street and give them a script to read from if they can speak even the slightest English.\n

reviews: \nI would give this a five star review but unfortunately it's too glitchy. It's like talking to one of those robo customer service centers where you have to constantly the same thing over and over. And to compound the problem Alexa can't answer your question when you're trying to find out what's wrong. It directs you online, which is a waste of time.\n

titles: Great sound for a smallish device
reviews: \nBought this to replace my old Echo Dot.  The sound is richer and it is not too large to be obtrusive on my desk.  Deducted a couple of stars as it fails in the same place that my other Echo devices do, speech recognition and command execution.  I am a fan of the Echo/Alexa platform, and I expect it to improve, but as of now, it just isn\u2019t as good as I want it to be.  Expect to spend a fair amount of time arguing with the device (trust me you will never win), and reviewing your voice history.  Keep the software up to date always as updates do bring improvements, although sometimes they seem to break things as well.  Seems we are all beta testers.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on May 13, 2021
reviews: \nAfter using this device for over a month or so I all of  sudden had problems with Alexa playing my playlists off of Amazon Music. Alexa started saying " Sorry I cant see your playlist such and such.  You must be an Amazon Music Unlimited Subscriber."  Well low and behold I have been an Amazon Music Unlimited Subcriber way before this speaker even come out.  Anyway to make a long story short. After 3 attempts talking withy Amazon  Specialists with no solution to the problem, I figured it out myself. Alexa couldn't see that I was a member of Music Unlimited because I didn't choose it through her "Alexa".  So I chose to do the free trial offer through her even though I'm already a member.  Now everything is working. What remains to be seen is if I get a double bill on the next billing cycle. And If I do, you can bet your bottom dollar I will address the situation. That's all I got to say about that.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on June 3, 2021
titles: Think she needs a hearing aid!
reviews: \nHave several echo devices in the home. So I just had to get one for my new office. Replaced light switches with smart switches and a couple of smart plugs. This echo was easy to set up. Most difficult was the wi-fi for what ever reason. Has nice sound for music play back. Controls switches and plugs extremely well. But my smart lock to-date hasn't paired. Not a big deal. But having to yell to get lights turned on is annoying.  This round echo seems to be hard of hearing. The taller cylindrical echos,( 2nd&3rd generation), seemed to have a better mic array. The echo ball seems to not hear as well, and find myself yelling or talking loudly to get a response. The white plug and cord is a bit sightly sitting on top of a filing cabinet. So in my opinion this new echo isn't quite up to par with the daily operations as the older 3rd generation echos I own. Maybe since it sits higher it doesn't capture sound as well. But none the less I still like the ball, but that fading as I keep yelling! I can be sitting in my quiet office and have to repeat the command. Sound is good but bass response is not as good as my 3rd generation echo, but could be differences of room settings and furnishings.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 25, 2021
reviews: \nThe number of issues we experience with Alexa renders it mostly useless and annoying.We don\u2019t need the advertisements and the app is hot garbage. Perhaps because we are software developers we have a higher expectation of how a user interface should work. The app sucks and the devices are unreliable.Consider other options before investing in a Sub, Studios, Dots etc.you\u2019re pretty invested at that point\u2026 and most likely unhappy as well.\n

titles: 4th Gen microphones are awful!  This device is practically deaf!
reviews: \nUpdate: Amazon just now stopped allowing unlimited SKIP on Amazon Music.  They now limit skips to 6 per hour.  I realize that this is not a big deal to most people, but to me is the continuation of the degradation of Amazon services and benefits of an expensive Prime subscription.I got this to replace my 2rd Gen Echo tower IN THE EXACT SAME LOCATION.  This new device is much worse for listening comprehension, and I must repeat everything loudly and slowly several times before she gets it.  The 'deafness' is extremely frustrating.  I wish that I had kept the 2rd Gen Echo which has the "far-field voice recognition" with the "array of seven microphones tucked under the light ring".  The 4th gen cuts microphones down to only four and moved their location.  It seems Amazon sacrificed hearing comprehension to give better sound quality.  I say they sacrificed too much.  Premium sound isn't any good if the device can't understand you.  I really hate this device.\n

Since I bought them to expressly play music this seems to be something of a useless purchase. I called customer service and just got a big run around for the first 15 minutes the person I was talking to basically acted like the fact it wouldn\u2019t play anything really wasn\u2019t a big deal and then later said he had just read that there was an issue with the units not being able to play things and when they figured things out they would give me a call. Nice. So basically I have 2 expensive paper weights. Like so many of the other reviewers have noted the white power cord with a black unit is hideous it\u2019s like Halloween every day . I would avoid this item until they get their stuff together.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 5, 2020
titles: Upgraded from Echo 1st Gen and disappointed
reviews: \nI had the original Echo 1st generation, and never felt the need to upgrade until I decided to add Zigbee devices and wanted to control them with a Zigbee compatible Echo... so I upgraded to the Echo 4. I now wish I'd gone with the Echo Studio instead. I'm not pleased with the sound quality of the Echo 4. The voice clarity is not as good as my original Echo 1, but even worse the music sound quality is not as good as the Echo 1. Partly, I miss the 360 degree sound projection of the Echo 1. The Echo 4 sound quality changes markedly depending on which direction you are from the device. The bass is a bit too heavy, and the treble is very muted. I adjusted the equalizer on the device to reduce the bass and increased the treble to maximum but this barely improved the equalization.Another issue I'm having, which never happened with the Echo 1 is that the Echo 4 will not respond to "Alexa Stop" when music is playing. In fact, I can't get the device to stop playing music with any command so I have to unplug it. Very frustrating.The good news is that the Echo 4 controls my Zigbee devices and setup of Zigbee devices was easy.If sound quality is important to you, I would recommend spending more for the Echo Studio and that's what I will do. The Echo 4 was a step down from my Echo 1 in every respect aside from Zigbee.UPDATE: I spoke with Amazon on the telephone (went online, submitted my phone number and they called me right away). Amazon (incredible employee named Gwen) took the time to work with me on methodical solutions to my problems with the Echo 4. She completely stood behind their product and their service. Gwen offered to replace the Echo 4, but since they aren't currently available she instead refunded the amount instantly. I subsequently found a solution to the problem with Alexa not responding to voice commands and it is now working as intended (I deleted the Groups I created for my various Echo devices around the house - this seems to have caused problems with certain devices not responding). I let Gwen know this, but she provided the refund and doesn't require me to return the Echo. I am 100% satisfied with Amazon support and customer service, and this gives me 100% confidence to continue buying their products. Amazon customer service completely exceeded my wildest expectations. I will be getting an Echo Studio for the better sound quality.\n

reviews: \nThis is my second Echo. I bought it after my original one stopped functioning. I've been disappointed. It's more annoying than useful and it will be the last one I buy.Update:  Spent a few days at a relative's home who has the newest Echo with the camera. It has the same problems as my Gen. 4.  It seems there has been a quality decrease in Echos.\n

But the biggest disappointment is the sound quality- it honestly sounds like a cheap battery powered radio from back in the day. It almost sounds like it constantly buzzes.This is actually my second one as I exchanged the first thinking it was defective. Nope. Just a crappy product.\n

reviews: \nDoesn't wait to let me finish what I'm telling her\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on October 26, 2020
titles: Not Impressed - Alexa got dumber? - Possible Annoyance Fix In Review
reviews: \nI purchased this to replace a gen 1 alexa.  The sound quality isn't as good in my opinion.  It's more directional vs the 360 sound I have know to come and love.  The microphone seems more direction as well.  It seems like it can't hear me at all angles so I find myself repeating often.  The absolute worst part is when added to a mesh of existing dots this Alexa proved to be unintelligent.  Alexa turn on television... my kitchen lights went on.  Alexa turn on cable.....no device found.  Look in the app and it shows "ke bel."  Alexa turn on Garage.... the device does not support this.... despite it being a group for the past year and working on all my other devices.  I have nearly every Amazon device.  This one is not worth it.  I miss my gen 1.  I even spent hours in the app re-doing my voice profile and everything including setting preferred speakers.  It just doesn't seem to be as good as the previous versions.  Sometimes I have to yell at it so loud that my other devices upstairs hear me and take over.  Totally bizarre.Update 10/30/2022 - There is a flaw with this new version.  I have "start of request sound" enabled on all of my amazon devices.  I can simply say "Alexa turn on cable" without any pause between Alexa and the rest of the sentence and she does her thing.  This new version however it is like they didn't shield alexa from it's own sounds or stops recording when it plays the wake sound.  Going in voice activity in the alexa app and re-playing the sounds and looking at what she heard will make this painfully obvious.  "alexa turn on cable" shows up as "alexa turn on ke bel."  Play back the audio and u will hear "Alexa turn on ca <wake sound> ble>."  This is a huge product flaw in my opinion.  To fix it turn off the start of request sound and she operates like normal.  Use the end of request sound only if you speak like me.Update 12/31/2020 - I decided to return the device for several reasons. The microphone as many others have discovered is flawed. It's not sensitive. You have to talk so loud other devices on different floors of your home hear you. No software update can fix bad hardware. Competitor devices have the ability to adjust mic sensitivity which is awesome. How do I know? After amazon started removing my reviews bc they were suspicious with no other explanation I am replacing all my alexa devices with their main competition and man they are better in every way so far. goodbye alexa.\n

Hoping the next gen will better as this is a swing and a miss.2023 Update - As with most things Amazon this Echo device has gotten worse over time. It has been packed up and replaced by a better brand. We miss Bezos as things were far better when he was CEO.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on February 15, 2021
reviews: \nI wish it was wireless.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on February 14, 2021
reviews: \nThe sound quality was actually impressive all things considered. We have this massive surround sound system now in the ceiling, walls and coming through the floor (yes my husband is ridiculous but even more important ladies/wives there is help for us to cope with their COVID mandiculousness. You don\u2019t have to suffer through it alone) ....... any who ....... compared to that obscenely priced yet perfectly balanced audio bliss ..... well obviously there is no comparison. But if you accept this is a smaller speaker and you adjust your expectations accordingly it\u2019s actually really impressive what this little thing can produce.However, we did not buy these as just speakers. We bought it for everything it was advertised it can do. We wanted a minion we could exercise our superiority over, that we could talk down to and force to refer to us with such lofty titles as \u201cJamesexander the Great\u201d and \u201ccutie wit da booty\u201d........And that\u2019s where the real let down came in. Like others have mentioned in their reviews I too had an impossible time getting this thing to just do what it was asked. When you ask it to do something it just...... doesn\u2019t. Maybe it\u2019s not on board with being called an \u201cit\u201d \U0001f937\U0001f3fd\u200d\u2640\ufe0fWhatever it\u2019s/her/their reason is for being defiant it doesn\u2019t work for me.  You set up skills and sometimes it works ..... sometimes it doesn\u2019t.I did really like that you could pair them and have music playing all over the back yard but that\u2019s about all it does and there are far better quality \u201cspeakers only\u201d in this price point.Thankfully I\u2019m still in my return window. Customer service was great and offered to try and walk me through troubleshooting. While they do have a 1 year free replacement warranty after the 30 day return window closes your replacement is likely REFURBISHED not brand new. Not a huge fan of paying full price then getting a refurb when the product fails. So with only 1 day to spare I will be returning for a full refund.Maybe later on down the line they\u2019ll get this thing dialed in but for now, for what I expected vs what I paid it\u2019s just not there yet. And honestly  ...... Im a baller .....on a budget! .......sooooooooo throwing away money is not an option.Unfortunately this item for me is a hard pass.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on November 28, 2022
titles: Ended up getting second generation echo on woot.com
reviews: \nI tried all of the echo devices and the echo Dot small globe type had static in it from the beginning ended up getting my money back. So I tried this one had it for a week the sound was okay but not to my liking ended up returning it I ended up getting a deal on the second generation echo which is the same as the third generation except for a hub built in at a good deal a third of what they charge for when they were new on woot.com that is owned by Amazon They were used but in great condition I purchased two and paired them as stereo and the sound is great to me. The only thing that beats it would be the echo Studio which I had one but are twice the cost of what I paid for the older echo devices. If you don't have a sound bar and just add a couple of echoes you can add it as a home theater mode but they have to be the same device. I tried it on the echo Studio the problem was it wasn't very easy to disconnect when you wanted to. I have a Vizio elevate Dolby Atmos soundbar that is excellent when I wake up in the morning or when I'm going to sleep I don't want the sound bar on and my TV speakers will play that I want. With pairing echoes in home theater like I said you cannot just turn it off easy and listen to your TV speakers that should be something Amazon should fix. But the sound I got from this echo device kind of seemed hollow to me like they're restricting it with the globe from coming out the sound even though it has two tweeters. Those echo second generations give off a 360\xb0 sound and gave me that close feeling to the echo Studio that I wanted with sound coming from areas you wouldn't think it would come from this unit did not do that. Hope I have helped.\n

titles: Great sound, difficulty with voice and connected devices
reviews: \nHeadline says it all.  The sound is excellent, I have no complaints.I do have issues when connecting the Echo as the speaker for my Amazon Fire TV, which was the only reason I upgraded the Echo.  Connection is always fuzzy despite the proximity of the router.  Also, when live streaming, the sound is off by about 5 seconds.This Echo is also much more difficult to voice activate.  My previous Echo and my Echo dot are both much better.  I will sometimes have to repeat myself until I just make the request from my phone.In short, this is an excellent Echo for music when you get it playing, but I wish I had just stayed with my older cylinder Echo.\n

reviews: \nI had high hopes for this awesome looking new Echo.  Alas, my hopes were dashed when I unboxed it and put it through it's paces. I find myself yelling at it more often than not and sometimes I even get an answer from my device in another room before this one picks me up.  Design is awesome Amazon, sound quality is great, but the voice recognition pickup is pretty poor.\n

dates: Reviewed in Mexico \U0001f1f2\U0001f1fd on March 6, 2022
reviews: \nTengo un Echo Dot 3G, y me agradaba el sonido, y decid\xed adquirirlo por el rendimiento del sonido que afirmaban (claro, el precio era atractivo). Se escucha muy bien el sonido, buena potencia, mas alto que el Dot, pero a tope se distorsiona. Indica la temperatura del \xe1rea y tiene sensores que puedes activar para apagar o encender equipos smart de acuerdo a infrasonidos (si alguien est\xe1 en una habitaci\xf3n). Tiene puerto 3.5 mm que se puede configurar desde la app como entrada o salida, y lo demas del Dot. Lo malo: esta sorda. Los nuevos Dot 4G tambi\xe9n tienen el mismo problema, pero el Echo de plano esta SORDA! tengo que gritar para que se active, no importa la palabra de activaci\xf3n, y sin estar reproduciendo y en silencio, casi a un lado. La app aun le falta para ser funcional, y prefiero reproducir m\xfasica dando \xf3rdenes a otro Dot que esta cerca para que lo haga en el Echo. No lo recomiendo para usar en est\xe9reo o como grupo de bocinas, no sirve, se desfasan y aparte se interfieren mutuamente. Pero de ah\xed al gusto de un buen sonido a ese precio, s\xfaper recomendable.\n

dates: Reviewed in Canada \U0001f1e8\U0001f1e6 on January 7, 2021
reviews: \nIt kills me to only give 3 stars for this product because I love the entire Echo/Alexa series but this Echo 4 is just nothing special compared to the other ones and can never hear me when I call it. Sometimes I call it 7-9 times before giving up and asking Google Nest or another Echo device. The ring light on the bottom is a poor design choice as well. There's just nothing new or exciting (besides colour) about Generation 4. Yes she's a bit quicker but sometimes that's a negative because she closes out before you get a chance to say anything/finish your question. Too much hassle to send back but will be last Amazon smart device until they come up with something new/exciting.I can't even find any use or even mention of the zigbee hub. The one thing I love which is probably unimportant to most is the indoor temperature feature. Love knowing the temperature in my room by asking. This is extremely hard of hearing and never wakes up when I ask it to, yet wakes up when its dead quiet. Very strange experience this purchase. Hopefully Amazon can release a fix (OTA) for the hearing issue as its a major issue and walking to control the echo 4 defeats its purpose.Update- no firmware updates have fixed anything yet, I love my echoes but I wish I had of bought another one with a screen as I find those ones 1000 times more useful. A Red ball is cool looking but that\u2019s about it. Having a screen has spoiled me.\n

dates: Reviewed in Mexico \U0001f1f2\U0001f1fd on February 28, 2021
reviews: \nEl tama\xf1o y la calidad del sonido, son muy buenos, casi perfectos; el color rojo me encant\xf3. Es el primer dispositivo Alexa (Echo) que adquiero, y la verdad, estoy un poco decepcionado; en primera, y creo lo peor de todo, son sus micr\xf3fonos. \u2639\ufe0f Son p\xe9simos, en la mayor\xeda de ocasiones, tienes que gritar o alzar mucho la voz para que el aparato reaccione, segundo; la interfaz de su intuici\xf3n, deja mucho que desear, muchas cosas no las entiende, te deja "en visto" o hasta te manda a cosas que no tienen nada que ver con lo que pides. \U0001f937\U0001f3fb\u200d\u2642\ufe0f Por \xfaltimo (de las cosas malas), algo que no es muy agradable y c\xf3modo, es el hecho de tener que hacer la pausa al hablarle a Alexa "para despertarla" y posteriormente dar la orden, ojal\xe1 pudiera arreglar eso por lo menos, para que la orden sea directa y en una sola oraci\xf3n, eso llega a ser desesperante en ocasiones. De bueno, como ya lo mencion\xe9, tama\xf1o, audio (calidad del sonido y potencia), con la opci\xf3n de modificar manualmente los bajos, medios y agudos. Pero fuera de eso, creo que tiene m\xe1s puntos en contra que a favor. L\xe1stima, ojal\xe1 mejoren eso pronto.\n

dates: Reviewed in Canada \U0001f1e8\U0001f1e6 on December 11, 2020
reviews: \nI like the sound, the red  colour is great , but I find the microphone(s) are less sensitive than my echo dot 3rd generation.
